page.title: 12FORESTRY COMMISSION_TREE USE
page.content: The Forestry Commission in our block consists of the nursery at Tair Onen and the plantation at Hensol Forest which we visited. It covers 8000 hectares of land. Most of the trees are conifers but some are deciduous to attract wildlife. Oak trees mature in 120 yrs, spruce trees in 60,so conifers are the minimum cash crop. The volume of wood taken from the forest is planned by computers.Felled trees are taken to local sawmills.The trees are mainly used for making paper,but others are sold for timber and firewood. Every year 40-50,000 Christmas trees are grown but more as a public service than for profit making. Fire is a problem. If it starts in dry ferns it can spread quickly and cause much damage.{ cont. P.13}
